bibl.title: Letter from Ida McGarvey to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 1, 1927

div1.p: This letter, written by a student of Edith R. Force, thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for the life and work of Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Ida McGarvey to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 1, 1927

opener.dateline:
Woodrow Wilson Junior High School
Tulsa, Oklahoma
June 1, 1927

div1.p:
As a friend of yours and a student of science, learning of
your contribution to the extermination of Yellow fever, I
will try to express, in my simple way my thanks and grati-
tude to you and your departed husband who have ment so much
to the world.

As I am a student of Woodrow Wilson Junior High School and
a young citizen of Tulsa--a thriving, prosprous and beaut-
iful city--I feel I am expressing a desire of both citizens
and students to have you visit our city and schools, if it
is possible.

I am especially interested in science and feel I owe a great
deal to the many friends who have given us our knowledge of
science. Our city school system offers the study of any
branch of science which a student wishes to study.

I again wish to express my gratitude to you for your long
and patient struggle in your part of the work and my desire
to have you visit our city and schools.
